description: Great story! It was pleasure for me to play this game.

I love this game. I died, of course. However, it was fun to play, and I learned a lot about the possibility of a run away climate catastrophe. I will continue to study the issues. I believe in the cost of solar and wind power has dropped below the cost of oil. Install this game, and have a hoot. Love the characters, the story line. Perfect for my prepping mind with respect to the zombie apocolypse (that didn't happen, thank God). Linux Rocks!! Thanks to Ren'Py for the tools.
not well designed and terrible propaganda theme

Don't get me wrong, this is a great game and I love playing it, but it needs some improvements to live up to what it could be. The first thing I noticed was the default text font used (Liberation Sans?). However, this did not stand out to me as much as the writing style did. It seemed as though the dialogue and narration was rushed. It was uncreative and there were many grammatical errors. My advice is to take your time, it's not like you're getting payed for completing the game before a deadline. However, I REALLY loved the graphics, and the gameplay in general was very good. Keep up the good work!
Why would someone make this??? I dont think re-formatting my hdd will recover the digital stains this game has permanently made on its magnetic surface. I may need some kind of priest!
It is very well put together and informative, though does seem like a propaganda piece (though I do agree with the points made).

description:
I don't hate this game because it's a "pro-climate propaganda". I'm myself a supporter of climate activist. If it was a RPG or a post-apocalyptic game similar to Mass Effect or any other similar game, it could have been a great game.

The problem is that it's just an educative game without gameplay.
Sure the game is short but its fun, they did a good job with the story and the survival aspect but also teaching us about climate change in our world today. I would highly recommend

I'm sorry, but you should actually read the math involved in the climate change alarmism. It's wrong! If you actually calculate the formulas contained in the reports, you get nonsensical answers like 2 = 16 (Verified by math proferssors).

Having taken college-level science classes regarding climate and the environment, I assure you the science is real. If anything the situation is much worse than Polyannas' make you think. Do your own research using your own five senses. This planet is in serious trouble.

This game will not be allowed on ay device in my house. The intent of this game is to normalize the "climate change" as a real threat when in fact its fiction.

description: boring commie propaganda

Just as I said, this game is good enough to make your feel the true heat of climate crisis. The fact that the game is successful in painting the existential threat is evident - just look at how polarizing the ratings are and how many 1-star it got. And to this later climate deniar group - I'm shocked to see so many among Ubuntu users, I say, just read the 2021 paper: "Update to Limits to Growth: Comparing the World3 Model with Empirical Data". The preprint is freely available at:

https://advisory.kpmg.us/content/dam/advisory/en/pdfs/2021/yale-publication.pdf.

The paper is done by a leading investor and not by some commie.

Back to the game, I believe there could've been some improvement - better cartoon, some puzzle solving type thing, enemies, ferral animals, some other kind of action etc. I understand the severe budget shortage. I just hope someone make it to an open world survival game where the protagonist will lose many companions and the player will be able to feel the loss properly.
summary: This game will put your face to face with the coming dreadful reality

description:
Haven't played the game but giving a 5 star to counteract the 1-stars from people who haven't played it but think they are miraculously more scientifically literate than those who work in the field. It's the classic comedians' quip, "I don't go to your work and slap the broom out of your hands."

Carbon dioxide has energy levels at the Earth's peak black-body radiation emission energies. It is truly inconceivable that carbon dioxide wouldn't act as a blanket to trap in heat. For it to not have a greenhouse effect would require all of quantum mechanics and thermal physics to be wrong. And, so, we say that if you deny climate change, you effectively deny science as a whole.
what does climate change even mean, considering the climate has never been static? earth has gone from molten lava to frozen ice ball before humans even existed. get over yourselves.
summary: giving this 1-star to spite the climate change propagandists

description:
You buy food/water going to your "destinatoin".
But you aren't told where any intermediate stops are.
So with that I bought food/water for a few days travel.
"I" died from lack of food/water.
It doesn't help that the route was not explained other than a highway number.  (Not helpful to non-native people)

description:
Climate Change is propaganda used by a country to scare another country out of using their 'fossil resources' so that they can come and take the resources.

Don't fall for this communist propaganda. Go ahead and use your oil and gas without fear. Live in freedom.

Not sure why so many of these reviews are pushing a political agenda. This is a game with realistic themes. Nowhere in this game do they mention they are advocating for communism or plotting against America, as some other reviewers have suggested. All these negative reviews have some sort of axe to grind. Just play the game and see if you like it--if you don't you can just come back here (or fire up the terminal) and uninstall.

summary: giving this five star reviews to make the idiots mad at me

description:
The tag line assumes humans control the climate. This is untrue. Milankovitch cycles are the chief driver of our climate changing.

We have had higher temperatures during the Holocene Climate Optimum with a smaller concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere. Ice core samples have shown this to be true. Sediment samples have shown this to be true.

We are approaching the end of the Holocene and should plan for lowering temperatures in the next few thousand years. Increasing carbon dioxide in the atmosphere will help plant life cope better with lowering temperatures, as well as help feed the people of this planet especially the poor.
summary: A fictional game not based in science

The concept is great! It makes our current ecologic outlook feel real and present. It's just a pitty that more wasn't invested into such a great concept: I hope that more sophisticated versions of this game will be produced, with better graphics and some more plot variations and twists. This kind of game could be easily improved by using a couple of cinematic excerpts (under-a-killing-moon style), and by adding variety to the challenges; occurences and characters.
Kudos to developer

I enjoyed this game. It raises the awareness about the climate change. The game propagates 100% use of the renewables, but if people would compute how much fossil fuel is being burnt to excavate the rare materials or the copper, and then manufacture the solar/wind energy piece. They'd find it costs more CO2 emissions than it actually saves. Only nuclear power produces thousands of times more energy than it takes fossil fuel to excavate the raw material. It can buy us some time.

Un jeu de survie après ou plutot pendant le déréglement extrême du climat. Il faut faire des choix, accompagné par des personnages (scientifiques et autres), qui vous donnent des indices de compréhension de ce qui se passe quand la température de la planète augmente... Faites les bons choix pour survivre...

Un bon jeu en somme !

description: Pas une seule attaque à main armée, aux Etats-Unis, de la part des autres personnages de l'histoire? Lisez «la Route» de Cormac Mc Carthy (prix Pulitzer 2007) qui place les personnages après une apocalypse nucléaire, ce grand écrivain vous donnera une idée de ce que feront les «méchants» quand ils en auront l'opportunité. Ce roman est disponible en DVD et VOD du film de 2009 de Jhon Hillcoat.
